entry.title: Russian Missiles Strike Ukrainian Base Near Polish Border
entry.content: The attack kills at least 35 people and increases the risk of war encroaching on NATO territory, after Moscow says that arms shipments to Kyiv won’t be tolerated.

entry.title: Inside One of Russia's Deadliest Assaults on a Ukraine City. 'They Want to Terrorize.'
entry.content: In the ancient city of Chernihiv, bodies were pulled from the rubble for days after a bombing shortly after the start of Russia’s invasion. The attack killed more than 47 people.

entry.title: Saudis Fight to Turn the Tide in Yemen's Civil War
entry.content: Saudi Arabia and the U.A.E. have stepped up their bombing campaign to support Yemen’s government as they try to stop Iran-backed Houthi rebels from seizing full control of the country’s north.

entry.title: Russia's Bombs Force Ukraine Into War Economy: 'Plants That Made Sweaters Are Making Weapons'
entry.content: Support from Ukrainian businesses and civilian institutions is helping the war effort and augmenting assistance from the West.

entry.title: China Pursues Afghanistan's Mineral Wealth After U.S. Exit
entry.content: A Chinese company is negotiating with the Taliban to mine one of the world’s largest untapped reserves of copper.
